issues.description: The UML in the problem statement declares Ride::getName() with return type char[] ("+getName(): char[]") while the Ride class attribute is name: String. The solution implements getName() returning String. This is an inner-artifact contradiction in the specification: students may be confused whether to implement getName() to return a String (matching the attribute and the solution/tests) or a char[] as shown in the UML diagram.
issues.suggested_fix: Fix the UML in the problem statement so the method return type matches the attribute and intended implementation. Change the UML line from "+getName(): char[]" to "+getName(): String". If the UML intended to require a getter for the abbreviation as well, explicitly add "+getAbbreviation(): char" to the UML. Ensure the textual description and any tests align with getName() returning String.
